name: Sopa de Fideo (Mexican Noodle Soup)
description: This is a great recipe to keep in mind for some comforting Sopa de Fideo -- a Mexican noodle soup made with a delicious tomato broth.

recipeInstructions.text: Start by roasting 4-5 tomatoes in the oven at 400F for 20 minutes or so.
recipeInstructions.name: Start by roasting 4-5 tomatoes in the oven at 400F for 20 minutes or so.

recipeInstructions.text: Saute 1.5 roughly chopped onions and 3 whole, peeled garlic cloves in a dollop of oil over medium heat. When the onion starts to turn brown (approx. 6-8 minutes) add the mixture to a blender or food processor along with the roasted tomatoes.  Combine well.
recipeInstructions.name: Saute 1.5 roughly chopped onions and 3 whole, peeled garlic cloves in a dollop of oil over medium heat. When the onion starts to turn brown (approx. 6-8 minutes) add the mixture to a blender or food processor along with the roasted tomatoes.  Combine well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the noodles to a saucepan along with a dollop of oil.  Cook the noodles over medium heat for 3-5 minutes or until some of them are turning darker brown.  Add the tomato-onion mixture from the blender and combine well with the noodles.  Let this mixture cook for a couple minutes and then add 8 cups of stock.   (When using homemade stock, I usually add at least 1/2 teaspoon of salt and some freshly cracked black pepper at this point.)
recipeInstructions.name: Add the noodles to a saucepan along with a dollop of oil.  Cook the noodles over medium heat for 3-5 minutes or until some of them are turning darker brown.  Add the tomato-onion mixture from the blender and combine well with the noodles.  Let this mixture cook for a couple minutes and then add 8 cups of stock.   (When using homemade stock, I usually add at least 1/2 teaspoon of salt and some freshly cracked black pepper at this point.)

recipeInstructions.text: Bring the soup to a boil and then reduce heat to a simmer and let it cook for 10-20 minutes, or until the noodles are cooked through.

recipeInstructions.text: Take a final taste for seasoning, adding more salt if necessary.   You can optionally add a pinch of Mexican oregano at this point.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately and store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge.
